title: WCAS PHIL 390-0-20 Special Topics In Philosophy

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class will involve a close reading of Kierkegaard's Concluding Unscientific Postscript with particular attention to the theme of indirect communication and the various philosophical reasons one might think it necessary to engage in such indirection. The central question of the course: are there are philosophic insights that cannot be directly conveyed by discourse? If there are such insights, what are the other options for communicating them?

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students are expected to understand the basic concepts of Kierkegaardian existentialism.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: i.) Participation & Attendance (20%) ii.) Weekly Assignment (30%) iii.) Final Paper (50%)

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
1. G. E. Lessing, Philosophical and Theological Writings [PTW], ed. H. B. Nisbet (Cambridge, 2005) ISBN: 978-0521538473

2. S. Kierkegaard, Concluding Unscientific Postscript [CUP], trans. A. Hannay (Cambridge, 2009) ISBN: 978-0521434225
